options.title: Options
options.whichVariablesShouldBeCreatedAndUpdated: Which variables should be created and updated?
options.whichStylesShouldBeCreatedAndUpdated: Which styles should be created and updated?
options.ignorePrefix: Ignore first part of token name for styles
options.ignorePrefixExplanation: Useful if you want to ignore 'colors' in a token called 'colors.blue.500' for your styles
options.prefixStyles: Prefix styles with active theme name
options.prefixStylesExplanation: Adds the active theme name to any styles created. Note: Using this with multi-dimensional themes will lead to unexpected results.
options.overwriteExistingStylesAndVariablesExpla: Existing styles and variables with the same name will be overwritten
options.scopeVariablesByTokenTypeExplanation: Variable scopes will be inferred from the token type and intended usage
options.createStylesWithVariableReferencesExplan: Styles will be created containing references to variables

exportThemesTab.headingBasic: Creating Themes is a pro Feature
exportThemesTab.introPro: Combinations of token sets create themes. Use Themes to create multiple collections of variables or styles for easy switching between design concepts like light or dark color modes, multiple brands, products or platforms. Or switch to Sets to export without using Themes
exportThemesTab.introBasic: Combinations of token sets create themes. Use Themes to create multiple collections of variables or styles for easy switching between design concepts like light or dark color modes, multiple brands, products or platforms.
exportThemesTab.combinationsOfSetsMakeThemes: Combinations of token sets create themes

exportSetsTab.changeSetsHeading: Enabled sets will export to Figma
exportSetsTab.intro: You can use token sets to manage your styles, and variables. Use Themes (Pro) to create multiple collections of variables or styles for easy switching between design concepts.
